items: Use Case: Verifying IP Address Configuration on Network Switches
Scenario:
A network administrator (PM) needs to verify the IP address configuration of network switches within a network infrastructure. This could be due to various reasons, such as:
Troubleshooting network connectivity issues: Incorrect IP addresses can hinder communication between devices.
Ipconfig: A Guide to Diagnosing and Troubleshooting Network Issues
blog.invgate.com
Security audits: Ensuring that IP addresses are configured securely and in compliance with security policies.
Network changes and upgrades: Verifying that IP address changes have been implemented correctly.
Routine maintenance and monitoring: Regularly checking IP address configurations to identify potential issues.
Steps Involved:
Identify the Switches:  It can be identifed within Org IP plan sheet
Determine the specific switches that require verification. This could be based on network topology, recent changes, or specific troubleshooting needs.
Gather Necessary Information: We have identified that Core switch having all the VLAN IP details
IP address of the management interface  : AI can connect to switch BLRCORE1 through ssh/snmp and shows the output as below
BLRCORE1#Sh ip int bri
Interface                  IP-Address      OK?      Method  Status Protocol
GigabitEthernet0/1           192.168.1.1    Yes       RARP    up     up
GigabitEthernet0/2           10.0.0.1       Yes       RARP    up     up
Vlan100                     172.16.100.1   Yes       RARP    up     up
Loopback0
Now PM can knows that what are the IP address exists.This will help PM
Verify IP Address Configuration:
Show IP Interface Brief: Use this command to display a summary of all IP interfaces on the switch, including their IP addresses, status, and protocol.
Show IP Interface: Use this command to display detailed information about a specific IP interface, including its IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and other configuration parameters.
Show VLAN: Use this command to display information about VLANs on the switch, including their VLAN ID, name, and associated IP addresses.
Check for IP Address Conflicts:
Use the show arp command to display the ARP table, which lists IP addresses and their corresponding MAC addresses.
Check for duplicate IP addresses on the network by analyzing the ARP table.
Document Findings:
Record the IP address configuration of each switch, including any discrepancies or issues identified.
Document any changes made to the configuration.

notes: To help the local IT network team connect CCTV cameras to the switch, the PM can provide the following information:
1. Switch Name: This is essential to identify the correct switch for connection.
2. Location of CCTV Cameras: This information will help the team determine the most suitable connection points on the switch and plan the necessary cabling.
Additional details that might be helpful:
CCTV Camera Model Numbers: This can provide information about the required power supply and network interface.
Number of CCTV Cameras: This will help the team estimate the number of network ports needed.
Existing Network Infrastructure: Any information about the current network setup, such as cable runs or existing network devices, can be useful for planning the connection.
Once the PM provides this information, the local IT network team can:
1. Verify Switch Location: Confirm that the specified switch is located in the appropriate area for connecting the CCTV cameras.
2. Identify Available Ports: Check for available network ports on the switch that can accommodate the CCTV cameras.
3. Plan Cabling: Determine the necessary cable runs and lengths to connect the CCTV cameras to the switch.
4. Configure Network Settings: Configure the switch and CCTV cameras with appropriate IP addresses and network settings.
5. Test Connection: Test the connection to ensure that the CCTV cameras are successfully communicating with the network and can be accessed remotely.
1. Verify Switch Location: Network Engineer finds that CCTV has to connect to Bangalore Office 2nd Floor Switch - Name : BLRSW001
This Command shows that what are the interfaces are down and can be used to connect
Interface IP-Address OK? Method Status Protocol
FastEthernet1/0/1 unassigned YES unset up up
FastEthernet1/0/2 unassigned YES unset down down
FastEthernet1/0/3 unassigned YES unset down down
FastEthernet1/0/4 unassigned YES unset up up
FastEthernet1/0/5 unassigned YES unset up up
FastEthernet1/0/6 unassigned YES unset down down
from this command ,we know that there is CCTV VLAN already exists.
So switch port status which shows down can be mapped to CCTV VLAN 3
PM has to see above outputs and share the details to Local IT to connect the CCTVs
Now PM has decided to connect the Port to FastEthernet1/0/2 and port has to be in vlan 3 (CCTV)
Local IT will conenct the Cables and CCTv team will test the connectivity

playbook.title: Verifying and Upgrading Cisco IOS Versions on Network Switches

Scenario: A Network Operations Center (NOC) team is responsible for maintaining a large network infrastructure composed of Cisco switches. To ensure optimal performance, security, and feature compatibility, the NOC team needs to regularly:
Verify Current IOS Versions:
Identify Outdated Switches: Determine which switches are running outdated IOS versions that may be vulnerable to security threats or lack critical bug fixes.
Assess Feature Compatibility: Check if switches have the necessary IOS features to support new network services or configurations, such as Layer 3 features or advanced security protocols.
Login to Switches database
Ex: NOC want to check the BLR Site2 Switches IOS information
NOC Engineer will check the BLR Site 2 Switches details.they found 4 switches - BLRACSW1,BLRACSW2,BLRACSW3,BLRACSW4
Login to BLRACSW1 by ssh/snmp
ssh BLRACSW1
BLRACSW1# Sh version
Example Output of show version:
Cisco IOS Software, C3750 Software (C3750-UNIVERSALK9-M), Version 15.2(4)S4, RELEASE SOFTWARE (fc2)

Tool has to connect to Database of switches and fetch the above details in document format or normal

nlp_corpus.prompt: What port should I connect any device.
nlp_corpus.scope: Scope: a1. Knowing the free port

details: b.       IP address to be assigned.
f.        Changing of VLAN on Port
PM wants to see which port in the swith for cameras
after PM question below questopns has to be asked by tool to know which switch it has to connect
please enter the switch name if you know or floor details
nlp_corpus.scope: He/she will identify the location switch name and ip address
